member.name: M:vxlapi_NET.XLDriver.XL_A429Receive(System.Int32,vxlapi_NET.XLClass.XLa429RxEvent@)
member.summary: Fetching events from driver queue.
member.remarks:
This method is used to fetch events, either bus events or acknowledgments for commands from the driver queue. Each call delivers only one event (if an event is available).
It is a synchronous mode and either delivers event data immediately, or indicates an error condition with its return value.
member.param: Was previously fetched by xlOpenPort API

This parameter must point to a buffer to which the driver can copy the next event of the receive queue. The "size" member of this struct specifies the maximum size of the buffer (header plus receive data); upon return, it holds the actual size.

member.name: M:vxlapi_NET.XLDriver.XL_A429Transmit(System.Int32,System.UInt64,System.UInt32,System.UInt32@,vxlapi_NET.XLClass.XL_A429_MSG_TX@)
member.summary: Transmit a Arinc429 word to the network.
member.remarks: This method is asynchronous; a confirmation of the transmit is received via an XL_A429_EV_TAG_TX_OK/XL_A429_EV_TAG_TX_ERR event.
member.param: Was previously fetched by xlOpenPort API
Access mask
Count of messages to be sent
Count of messages actually sent
Pointer to an Arinc429 frame to be sent

member.name: M:vxlapi_NET.XLDriver.XL_A429SetChannelParams(System.Int32,System.UInt64,vxlapi_NET.XLClass.XL_A429_PARAMS)
member.summary: Configures basic Arinc429 settings.
member.remarks: This method is used to configure the basic Arinc429 settings like parity, bitrate, etc.
member.param: Was previously fetched by xlOpenPort API
Access mask
New Arinc429 parameter to set

member.name: M:vxlapi_NET.XLDriver.XL_CanFdSetConfiguration(System.Int32,System.UInt64,vxlapi_NET.XLClass.XLcanFdConf)
member.summary: Sets up a CAN FD channel. The structure differs between the arbitration part and the data part of a CAN message.
member.param: The port handle returned by xlOpenPort().
Mask specifying the channels that are affected.
Configuration object to set up a CAN FD channel.

member.summary: Transmits a CAN FD message on the selected channels.
member.param: The port handle returned by xlOpenPort().
Mask specifying the channels that are affected.
Amount of messages which were transmitted.
User buffer with a single messages to be transmitted.

member.summary: Transmits multiple CAN FD messages on the selected channels.

Mask specifying the channels that are affected.

member.name: M:vxlapi_NET.XLDriver.XL_CanReceive(System.Int32,vxlapi_NET.XLClass.XLcanRxEvent@)
member.summary: Receives a CAN FD messages on the selected port.

member.name: M:vxlapi_NET.XLDriver.XL_CanGetEventString(vxlapi_NET.XLClass.XLcanRxEvent)
member.summary: Returns a string based on the passed CAN Rx event data.
member.param: Event buffer with the received CAN FD message to be printed.

members.member:
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Enables/disables TX/TXRQ receipts for transmitted messages
The port handle returned by xlOpenPort(). Mask specifying the channels that are affected. 0: disable TX receipts, 1: generate TX receipts. 0: disable TXRQ receipts, 1: generate TX receipts. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Allows/suppresses error frames and chip state events. Default is to allow error frames and chip state events.
The port handle returned by xlOpenPort(). 0: allow error frames, 1: suppress error frames 0: allow chip state events, 1: suppress chip state events -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Sets acceptance filter.
The port handle returned by xlOpenPort(). Mask specifying the channels that are affected. The acceptance code for id filtering. The acceptance mask for id filtering, bit = 1 means relevant. To distinguish whether the filter is for standard or extended identifiers XL_CAN_STD or XL_CAN_EXT (see XLCLass.XLacceptanceFilter). -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

member.name: M:vxlapi_NET.XLDriver.XL_EthSetConfig(System.Int32,System.UInt64,System.UInt16,vxlapi_NET.XLClass.T_XL_ETH_CONFIG)
member.summary: Configures basic Ethernet settings. This function needs init access.
member.param: The port handle retrieved by xlOpenPort.
The mask of channels to be accessed.
The handle is created by the application and is used for the event assignment.
Ethernet configuration structure.

member.name: M:vxlapi_NET.XLDriver.XL_EthGetConfig(System.Int32,System.UInt64,System.UInt16,vxlapi_NET.XLClass.T_XL_ETH_CONFIG@)
member.summary: Reads the basic Ethernet settings from the device that was configured last.
member.param: The port handle retrieved by xlOpenPort.
The mask of channels to be accessed.
The handle is created by the application and is used for the event assignment.
Ethernet configuration structure.

member.name: M:vxlapi_NET.XLDriver.XL_EthTransmit(System.Int32,System.UInt64,System.UInt16,vxlapi_NET.XLClass.T_XL_ETH_DATAFRAME_TX)
member.summary: Transmits an Ethernet frame on the channel which is indicated in accessMask.
member.param: The port handle retrieved by xlOpenPort.
The mask of channels to be accessed.
The handle is created by the application and is used for the event assignment.
The Ethernet frame to be sent.

member.name: M:vxlapi_NET.XLDriver.XL_EthReceive(System.Int32,vxlapi_NET.XLClass.T_XL_ETH_EVENT@)
member.summary: Retrieves one event from the event queue. This operation is synchronous.
member.param: The port handle retrieved by xlOpenPort.
Buffer for a single Ethernet event.

members.member:
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Returns the actual cluster configuration depending on the channel.
The port handle retrieved by xlOpenPort (see XL API Description). Mask specifying the channels that are affected. Object that returns the cluster configuration. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Initializes the coldstart and defines the sync frame.
The port handle returned by xlOpenPort(). Mask specifying the channels that are affected. FlexRay event buffer with the Sync Frame content to be transmitted. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The function sends static and dynamic frames with the event tag TX.
The port handle returned by xlOpenPort(). Mask specifying the channels that are affected. FlexRay event buffer with the content to be transmitted. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Sends a symbol window during the next following symbol window as configured by xlFrSetupSymbolWindow.
The port handle returned by xlOpenPort(). Mask specifying the channels that are affected. Defines the Media Access Symbol. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

.NET implementation of WaitForSingleObject.
The handle returned by XL_SetNotification(). The time-out interval, in milliseconds. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Gets information about the application assignment which is set in the Vector Hardware Configuration tool.
Application name in Vector Hardware Config. Selects the application channel (0,1,...). Returned hardware type. Returned hardware index. Returned hardware channel. Specifies the bus type which is used by the application. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Creates a new application in Vector Hardware Config or sets the channel configuration in an exiting application.
Name of the application to be set. Application channel (0,1,...) to be accessed. The hardware type to be stored. The hardware index withing a hardware type. The channel index of the selected hardware. Specifies the bus type for the application. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Opens a port for a bus type (e.g. CAN) and grants access to the different channels that are selected by 'accessMask'.
The port handle returned by xlOpenPort(). Name which is displayed in Vector Hardware Config for a given hardware. Mask specifying the channels that are affected. Mask specifying the channels that are affected for init access. Specifies the number of events that can be stored in the queue. Current API version. Bus type that should be activated. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Sets the rate for the port's cyclic timer events (channel specific).
The port handle returned by xlOpenPort(). Mask specifying the channels at which timer events may be generated. Value specifying the interval for cyclic timer events generated by a port. If 0 is passed, no cyclic timer events will be generated. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
This function returns an array with all available licenses from the selected Vector device.
The channel mask of the Vector device containing the licenses. Array that returns the license info. Size of the array. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Reads/sets the software synchronization setting in the Vector Hardware Config tool.
New value to be set. Variable that stores the previous value.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Configures the analog lines.
The port handle returned by xlOpenPort(). Mask specifying the channels that are affected. Mask for lines to be configured as input. Mask for lines to be configured as output. Mask for lines that should use high range mask for input resolution. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Sets analog output line to the required voltage level.
The port handle returned by xlOpenPort(). Mask specifying the channels that are affected. Voltage level in mV for AIO0. Voltage level in mV for AIO1. Voltage level in mV for AIO2. Voltage level in mV for AIO3. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Sets the analog trigger functionality up.
The port handle returned by xlOpenPort(). Mask specifying the channels that are affected. Line to be used as trigger input. Currently only supported by line AIO3 of the IOcab 8444opto (mask = 0b1000). Voltage level in mV for the trigger. Selects the event trigger mode. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Configures the digital lines. Per default all lines are set to input.
The port handle returned by xlOpenPort(). Mask specifying the channels that are affected. Mask for lines to be configured as input. Mask for lines to be configured as output. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Sets digital output line to a required logical level.
The port handle returned by xlOpenPort(). Mask specifying the channels that are affected. Mask specifying the lines that are affected). Mask specifying the switch state for digital output. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Changes PWM output to defined frequency and value.
The port handle returned by xlOpenPort(). Mask specifying the channels that are affected. PWM frequency in Hertz. Allowed values: 40...500 Hertz and 2.4kHz...100kHz. Ratio for pulse high/pulse low times with resolution of 0.01 percent. Allowed values: 0 (100% pulse low)...10000 (100% pulse high). -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Defines the voltage level for logical high and logical low (digital input).
The port handle retrieved by xlOpenPort. Mask specifying the channels that are affected. 10 bit value that defines the voltage level (mV) for the input threshold. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Execute fast init sequence followed by a data frame (tester). Called after activating the channel.
The port handle returned by xlOpenPort(). Mask specifying the channels that are affected. Data buffer length in bytes. Set to 1 to send a single byte of a K-Line frame. The maximum length is limited to 300 bytes K-Line data buffer. Contains a complete K-Line TX frame
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Transmit a complete K-Line frame. Can be also used to send a single byte.
The port handle returned by xlOpenPort(). Mask specifying the channels that are affected. Data buffer length in bytes. Set to 1 to send a single byte of a K-Line frame. The maximum length is limited to 300 bytes. K-Line data buffer. Contains a complete K-Line TX frame -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Sets up a LIN slave.
The port handle returned by xlOpenPort(). Mask specifying the channels that are affected. LIN ID on which the slave transmits a response. Contains the data bytes. Defines the dlc for the LIN message. Defines the checksum calculation. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

member.name: M:vxlapi_NET.XLMarshalling.Read_A429RxEvent(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Reads properties of a XLClass.XLa429RxEvent object from a byte array.

members.member:
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Creates and opens a CAN port of the named application/channel number. If the application name is unkown in the Vector Hardware Config, it will be created automatically with two CAN channels.
Name of application in Vector Hardware Config. Channel number of the application to be used (Vector Hardware Config). -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
